newsitem.title: HONG KONG: China Tangshan Steel sets price for A share IPO.
newsitem.headline: China Tangshan Steel sets price for A share IPO.

text.p: Tangshan Steel and Iron Co Ltd said on Tuesday it has set the price of a 120 million A shares initial public offering at 9.22 yuan each for listing on the Shenzhen stock exchange.
The company had approval from the China Securities Regulatory Commission for the offer, a company official told the Hong Kong-based newsletter China Securities Bulletin.
The firm has named China Guotai Securities Co as lead underwriter, he said.
Tangshan Steel, one of China's top 10 steel works, would use share proceeds to build a 2,500-cubic-metre furnace to expand steel and iron output.
The company on average made 2.2 million tonnes of steel and 2.1 million tonnes of iron each year, he said.

Tangshan Steel, which became a shareholding firm in 1994, will have after the offer total share capital of 793.2 million, made up of 562 million state shares, 94 million legal persons shares, 17.2 million staff shares and 120 million A shares, he said. The company, based in Tangshan city in Hebei province, estimated pre-tax profits at about 800 million yuan for 1996, compared with 700 million yuan in 1995, he said.
The company paid corporate income tax at 33 percent over the past few years and expects to be accessed at 15 percent after going public, the official added.
